tab_content.accordion_title: Can I talk to a doctor on Maple about my cold sore?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes. In most cases, a doctor on Maple can treat cold sores online by asking about your symptoms and by taking a look at the affected area through a photo or by video. Once you describe your symptoms to the doctor, they’ll be able to provide a diagnosis, write necessary prescriptions, and recommend an appropriate course of treatment. If the doctor suspects you have a more serious problem, they may suggest for you to go to a clinic for a thorough physical examination.
tab_content.accordion_content: In select provinces, you can also request to see a dermatologist right on Maple about your stasis dermatitis. To learn more about how our online dermatology assessments work, please click here.

tab_content.accordion_title: Can I get a prescription on Maple?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes, our physicians can prescribe medications online during your consultation. Once you accept a prescription, you’ll have the option to pick it up from any pharmacy or to have it delivered right to your door at no additional cost.
tab_content.accordion_content: You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

tab_content.accordion_intro: Cold sores — also called fever blisters — are a common viral infection caused by the Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV). They are tiny, fluid-filled blisters on and around your lips. These blisters are often grouped together in patches. After the blisters break, a crust forms over the resulting sore. Cold sores are usually healed in 2-4 weeks.

tab_content.accordion_title: What are the symptoms of cold sores?
tab_content.accordion_intro:
Symptoms of cold sores include:

  • Tingling and itching 
  • Blisters 
  • Oozing and crusting
tab_content.accordion_content:
People may also experience: 

  • Fever
  • Painful eroded gums
  • Sore throat
  • Headache
  • Muscle aches
  • Swollen lymph nodes

tab_content.accordion_title: How can I treat cold sores?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Doctors can prescribe a variety of different medications to help treat cold sores. Prescriptions include oral medications as well as topical creams to prevent spreading and reduce signs. Common antiviral prescriptions include Acyclovir (Xerese, Zovirax), Valacyclovir (Valtrex), Famciclovir (Famvir), and Penciclovir (Denavir)

With Maple, you can start talking to a doctor about your symptoms in a matter of minutes. We’re a healthcare app for fast, convenient 24/7 access to Canadian doctors.

You simply log in, tap a button to request a consultation, and we’ll immediately connect you to a doctor via live chat or video. You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

Our doctors can assess symptoms, and provide treatment, including prescriptions as necessary.
tab_content.accordion_content: Additionally, for select provinces, you may see a dermatologist on Maple about your stasis dermatitis the same way you would request a consultation with a general practitioner. Maple’s dermatologists are able to provide you with a diagnosis, necessary notes, treatment plans, and prescriptions within 24 hours.
